summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case, changing the location of a hearing on her motion for a new trial to Courtroom 110 of the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse and detailing COVID-19 entry protocols for attendees.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case for whom a hearing on a motion for a new trial is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed the order, setting the hearing details and COVID-19 protocols.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the legal proceedings involving defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Hearing on Motion for New Trial
events.description: A hearing scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a new trial, to be held at the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse.

locations: Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Centre Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: A hearing on Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a new trial was scheduled for March 8, 2022, at 10:00 a.m.
The hearing location was changed to Courtroom 110 of the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse in New York.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were in place for courthouse entry, including mask requirements and a health questionnaire.
Judge Alison J. Nathan issued the order on March 3, 2022.
